faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about the domestic robot market

marketSize.question: What is the real size of the domestic robot market today?
marketSize.answer: The global domestic robot market is estimated between $10 and $14 billion in 2024-2025 according to several research firms. This value is mainly driven by utility robots, particularly robot vacuums, which account for the majority of sales and revenue in the segment.

growth.question: Is the domestic robot market really growing rapidly?
growth.answer: Yes, the domestic robot market is experiencing sustained growth, with an estimated compound annual growth rate between 15% and 20%. This growth mainly concerns the expansion of existing segments like cleaning robots, rather than mass adoption of versatile domestic robots.

households.question: How many domestic robots are actually present in households?
households.answer: Estimates indicate that approximately 40 million domestic robots could be present in households worldwide around 2025, and more than 50 million units by 2027. This volume remains low compared to other common household equipment, confirming the still marginal nature of the market.

types.question: What types of domestic robots actually dominate the market?
types.answer: The most common domestic robots are specialized robots, such as vacuums and floor washers, autonomous lawn mowers, and pool robots. These categories concentrate most of the adoption and revenue, while more complex robots remain marginal.

niche.question: Why do domestic robots remain niche products despite market growth?
niche.answer: Domestic robots remain niche products because their use value is limited to specific tasks, their cost remains high, and their reliability decreases when uses become complex. For most households, these products are not yet perceived as essential.

limits.question: What are the main technological limitations of current domestic robots?
limits.answer: The main technological limitations concern object manipulation in unstructured environments, understanding the domestic context, and safety in the presence of humans. These constraints explain why domestic robots avoid complex physical interactions.

cost.question: What is the real long-term cost of a domestic robot?
cost.answer: The real cost of a domestic robot includes the purchase price, maintenance, spare parts, software updates, and sometimes cloud subscriptions. Over several years, the total cost of ownership can far exceed the initial investment.

mainstream.question: When will domestic robots really become mainstream?
mainstream.answer: Domestic robots will become mainstream when three conditions are met: clear use value, controlled safety, and accessible cost. In the short and medium term, the market will evolve mainly through gradual improvement of specialized robots.

store.title: Store
store.subtitle: Discover all available skills for your robots
store.disclaimerText: The skills shown illustrate the potential of the platform when the robotic ecosystem is fully operational.

roadmap.title: The evolution of domestic robotics
roadmap.subtitle: Understanding the market trajectory
roadmap.conclusion: The adoption of domestic robots does not happen instantly. It follows a
roadmap.conclusionEnd: , from current connected devices to robots capable of evolving with usage.

1.title: Connected devices and specialized robots
1.subtitle: Real uses, already established in households
1.description: Households are already equipped with connected devices and specialized domestic robots (cleaning, maintenance, surveillance). These solutions meet concrete needs but remain limited in their ability to evolve.

2.title: First intelligent units
2.subtitle: Tests, pilots and controlled deployments
2.description: More advanced robots are beginning to be tested in certain homes or pilot environments. These first units validate more complex technologies and identify relevant uses.

3.title: Progressive industrialization
3.subtitle: Scaling up driven by manufacturers
3.description: Manufacturers are implementing industrialization strategies over several years to make robots more reliable, more accessible and deployable at scale.

4.title: Adoption and extended capabilities
4.subtitle: Towards evolving and customizable robots
4.description: Once widely deployed, domestic robots become evolving platforms. Users can discover, activate and enrich their robots with new capabilities.

docsGettingStarted.title: Submission Guide
docsGettingStarted.description: Learn how to submit your skill on the Robot Store
docsGettingStarted.publishIn4Steps: Publish your skill on the Robot Store in 4 steps.
docsGettingStarted.noteText: The Robot Store is a distribution platform. Skill development is done with tools provided by each manufacturer. Consult their resources to create your skill before submitting it here.

1.title: Get a developer license
1.description: Sign up for the developer program and activate your annual license to access the submission platform.
details: Create your account on the Robot Store

2.title: Prepare your package
2.description: Build the complete package for your skill with all required elements.
details: ZIP package of your skill (source code or binary)

3.title: Choose target manufacturers
3.description: Select the robot brands compatible with your skill.

4.title: Submit for validation
4.description: Send your package for review by the platform and OEMs.

docsGettingStarted.afterValidationText: Once approved by the targeted manufacturers, your skill will be published on the store and available to users with compatible robots.

cookiesPage.title: Cookie Policy
cookiesPage.whatIsCookieText: A cookie is a small text file stored on your device when you visit a website. Cookies allow the site to remember your actions and preferences (login, language, font size, etc.) for a certain period of time.
cookiesPage.essentialCookiesText: These cookies are necessary for the Platform to function. They allow:
cookiesPage.performanceCookiesText: These cookies help us understand how you use the Platform:
cookiesPage.thirdPartyCookiesText: We use third-party services that may set cookies:
cookiesPage.manageCookiesText: You can manage your cookie preferences at any time:
manageCookiesList: Via the consent banner on our site
cookiesPage.refusalConsequencesText: If you refuse certain cookies, some features of the Platform may not work correctly:
refusalConsequencesList: You will need to log in again each visit
Your preferences will not be remembered
Some personalized features will be disabled
cookiesPage.modificationsText: This policy may be updated to reflect changes in our use of cookies. The last update date is shown at the top of the page.
cookiesPage.contactText: For any questions about our use of cookies, contact us at privacy@robotskills.io.
